summary:
Hey there! I'm a UX/UI designer from Colombia, living in Colombia and working remotely with international clients.

I've worked as a versatile designer for over 5 years but recently obtained a BSc in UX Design at The Hague University of Applied Sciences. I've found a passion for human-centered design and the process from empathizing with a user to getting a validated product into the market. My previous experience in different industries (art, sales, retail, design, music, etc.) has allowed me to develop business skills, which in turn help me balance user-derived insights with business requirements in an agile project approach. I am an excellent team asset, always eager to learn, and keen on keeping all critical stakeholders in the loop. 

I'm also just an outgoing guy, with an entrepreneurial side and a soft spot for food, drinks, and music!

Mainblades Flight App: I worked on creating the first version of the app, which involved following a full design process from the ground up. From empathising with the users in their environment, customising and applying UX research methods, conducting co-creation sessions, generating user stories and requirements, to creating and iterating concepts, sparring ideas with other team members, understanding and applying Apple's design guidelines and hand-off best practices, and validating prototypes with real users, while making sure all key stakeholders were informed and involved with the entire process.

Mainblades Web Portal: After two iteration cycles with the app, we began creating the desktop version of the Mainblades' product. Following a more agile approach, and based on the insights previously discovered and validated, I've created concepts that follow a more defined set of guidelines and move along the development process in a more streamlined manner.
